data.title: [GDNative] GlobalConstants not exposed from ClassDB
[2.1.3 rc2] Parsing errors in scripts
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Regression on 2.1.3 rc2  on rc1 it was fine

**Issue description:**
My scripts in 2.1.3 rc2 are not parsing properly, I have a lot of "Error parsing expression, misplaced X"
It apply to const, sometimes functions and possibly other things as well.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Create new node, attach a script to it.
2. Fill the script with content:
```
extends Node

#physic layers
const LAYER_0_ALL = 0;
const LAYER_12_HERO = 12;

static func someFunc(someParam):
	if(someParam==LAYER_0_ALL): return LAYER_12_HERO;
	if(someParam==LAYER_12_HERO): return LAYER_0_ALL;

# PRICES
const PRICE_STONE_BUY = 50;  #THIS IS LINE 12
const PRICE_STONE_SELL = 25;
const PRICE_STONE_FACTORY = 75;

```
3. Observe parsing error: `error (12,1): Error parsing expression, misplaced: const`




**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

```
env.android_add_default_config("minSdkVersion 15")
```

data.title: Renaming the DLScript module
data.body:
Some people were confused about the name "DLScript".
DLScript stands for "dynamic linking script". It's a module used for using shared libraries as scripts.

The confusion stems from the fact that a "script" is usually a computer program *written in a scripting language*. Since DLScript deals with binary files (shared libraries) there are no direct scripting languages in use.

This name was chosen in the first place because game logic in Godot is accessed via the *scripting system* and all this module does is *dynamically link in* native code.
Also you're adding a *"script"* to a node, so it made sense to us to include "Script" in the module name.

Those are implementation details which not every user of Godot is aware of.

-------------

Now I'm asking for pros and cons of a rename and what name you think is better suited.
Please only make suggestions if you know remotely how this module works, what it does and *what it is not*. The [blog post](https://godotengine.org/article/dlscript-here) and the [FAQ](https://github.com/GodotNativeTools/godot_headers/blob/master/README.md) should give you a good insight to be able to constructively join the discussion.

Some suggestions that were made this far:
 * Godot/Native (or GDNative)
 * DLBridge
 * NativeBridge or NativeLink / DLBridge or DLLink

data.title: Spaces to tabs and layout adjustments on .mm files

Applied a bunch of layout changes to .mm files to bring them in line with the clang reformatting we've done for C++ files. Hopefully got most of it. 
Will do the same for Godot 3 later in the week.

data.title: New Process class
data.body:
### DO NOT MERGE GUARD

This class allows spawning child processes in a non-blocking way while, unlike `OS::execute()`, allowing to keep track of its lifetime and doing IO operations.

The interface is heavily inspired on QProcess and a bit on D's std.process (redirect flags and env).

Notes:
- This commit removes our old SIGCHLD handler (introduced by #7774), which would conflict with forkfd's one that is used by the Process class. OS_Unix::execute() now depends on forkfd, which is used instead of fork() if the condition `!p_blocking` is met.
- `OS_Unix::execute()` calls forkfd_nofd() instead of forkfd(). Unlike the latter, forkfd_nofd() does not create any file descriptor to track the child process. This allows forkfd to be used by `OS_Unix::execute()` without gdb notifying (unless a startup command is specified) of SIGPIPE signals, since `OS_Unix::execute()` would immediately close the returned file descriptor otherwise.

Tested on the following platforms:

- [x] x11 (Ubuntu 16.04 64bit)
- [ ] server
- [x] windows (Windows 7 64bit)
- [ ] osx
- [ ] iphone
- [ ] android
- [ ] haiku
- [ ] bb10
- [ ] uwp

I can't test on the unchecked platforms, I don't have access to them (well, android, but...).

Example: https://gist.github.com/neikeq/5b3ab0461733d1100561b0ba227a19e0

Docs will come later.

data.title: Bug: HScrollbar slider cannot be grabbed when at leftmost side.
data.body:
**Godot 2.1.2 Stable for Linux**


**Issue description:
 When the slider of the scrollbar is at the far left side, which
is the min value, I cannot grab the slider with the mouse.
    I insured that no other control node or selectable node was
obstructing selection of the slider.
    The slider is still highlighted when the mouse hovers
over the bar but the moment the mouse pointer is within
range of grabbing the slider the slider stops being highlighted.
    The issue caused by the bug is alleviated by setting the
sliders page value to a higher setting. Doing so lets the mouse
pointer grab the right portion of the slider but not the middle
or left side of the slider.
    I apologize if I formatted this incorrectly as this is my first
time reporting a bug for Godot.**

 


**Node: HScrollbar
Node Settings:

Custom Step: -1

Min: 0

Max: 255

Step: I set it to many different steps. 0-123

Page: 10 or less

Exp Edit: False or True

Rounded: False or True

Anchor
Left: Begin
Top: Begin
Right: Begin
Bottom: Begin

Rect
Size (154, 12)
Min Size(0,0)
Rotation 0
Scale(1, 1)

Ignore Mouse: True or false
Stop Mouse: True or False

Size Flags
Horizontal: Fill
Vertical: null
Stretch Ratio: 1

I have no theme installed

Margin
Left 0
top - 68
right 154
bottom -56

no custom icons or styles

Visible true
Opacity 1
Self Opacity 1
Behind Parent false
Blend Mode: Mix
Light Max: bit 0

No materials

process Inherit
Script null.

When the slider is small, I cannot grab the slider with the pointer when 
the slider is on the far left slide of the bar**


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Optimize-out some debug and/or non-tools methods
data.body:
Collisions and nav debug are conditionally compiled depending on DEBUG_ENABLED
is_editor_hint() and is_node_being_edited() are compiled only with TOOLS_ENABLED
Every affected method is implemented in the header in case its macro is not present (the getters just returning false and the setters having an empty body) so the compiler can inline and finally no-op-out them as likely as possible.
is_node_being_edited() already showed a similar optimization effort and has been adapted to this change.
Furthermore, and as a consequence, -debugcol and -debugnav will not work on non-debug (strict release) builds.
This can bring a little bit of runtime performance on release and non-tooled builds (less code, so less cycles to spend and maybe more cache friendly).

data.title: Optimize-out some debug and/or non-tools methods (2.1)
data.body:
Collisions and nav debug are conditionally compiled depending on DEBUG_ENABLED
is_editor_hint() and is_node_being_edited() are compiled only with TOOLS_ENABLED
Every affected method is implemented in the header in case its macro is not present (the getters just returning false and the setters having an empty body) so the compiler can inline and finally no-op-out them as likely as possible.
is_node_being_edited() already showed a similar optimization effort and has been adapted to this change.
Furthermore, and as a consequence, -debugcol and -debugnav will not work on non-debug (strict release) builds.
This can bring a little bit of runtime performance on release and non-tooled builds (less code, so less cycles to spend and maybe more cache friendly).

data.title: Bug in AnimationPlayer and Keys disappearing
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win 10
Godot 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
*Select "Animation" tab.  
Key symbol next to properties in the inspector are toggling off while in the AnimationPlayer.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Keys appear next to all properties in the inspector.
*Next select either "Output", "Debugger" or "Texture Region" tab.
Keys are still showing next to the properties in the inspector.
*Now go back to the Animation tab by selecting it.
The Keys next to the properties are now toggled off when they should be on.

Subsequently, you have to select another node to turn the keys back on.

data.title: Reset display folded for an instanced scene if editable children is toggled off
data.body:
I noticed this on one of my __.tscn__ files:
`editor/display_folded = true`
And that would never go away unless I re-enabled edit children, unfold it and disabled edit children back.

This avoids the display folded flag needlessly getting into the scene file (potentially forever) and also gives more visual feedback if the user re-enables editable children so it will display unfolded at first.

data.title: Reset display folded for an instanced scene if editable children is toggled off (2.1)
data.body:
I noticed this on one of my __.tscn__ files:
`editor/display_folded = true`
And that would never go away unless I re-enabled edit children, unfold it and disabled edit children back.

This avoids the display folded flag needlessly getting into the scene file (potentially forever) and also gives more visual feedback if the user re-enables editable children so it will display unfolded at first.

data.title: [GDNative] implement rest of the core API
data.body:
There are a few core types which don't have all important methods exposed to the C API.

The most "dramatic" ones are

~~[godot_image](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/dlscript/godot/godot_image.h): I only implemented basic contructors, height and width, load and save. It would be cool to have at least all methods that are [exposed to varcall](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/classes/class_image.html) implemented here. (if you want to go further and include functions only available to C++ then that's cool as well).~~

[godot_string](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/gdnative/godot/godot_string.h): Basically only has a constructor, a way to get the data back out of it, equality and concatenation. The [C++ class](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/ustring.h) has a lot more functions that are also very important, (like `String::num()`). Also a function to get a `char *` would be nice, using `wchar_t *` can be a pain.

------------

~~Other types have missing C functions as well, but those functions can be implemented in the language binding much easier than string and image.~~

 * ~~[godot_vector3](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/dlscript/godot/godot_vector3.h)~~
 * ~~[godot_vector2](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/dlscript/godot/godot_vector2.h)~~
 * ~~[godot_transform2d](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/dlscript/godot/godot_transform2d.h)~~

~~Maybe there are more, but these are the ones I can think of right now. Probably all of the C wrapped core types lack functionality. Feel free to wrap the C++ classes as much as possible.~~

------------

~~Also, there's no equivalent of GDScript's `print()` or C++'s `print_line()`. So currently it's not possible to write to the in-editor-console using DLScript. A `godot_print()` function that does that would be cool. Such a function would live in [`godot.h/.c`](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/modules/dlscript/godot.h)~~

------------


# Update

only really `string` methods are missing.
The rest is more or less complete, mostly thanks to @touilleMan  and also @sheepandshepherd.

Also @cynicaldevil for the efforts of wrapping Image, but that was removed recently, so your changes are obsolete 🙁 




If there are any questions, message me on IRC or Discord

data.title: Add priority to samples in a library (2.1)
data.body:
This adds a pretty useful feature: now sample entries in a `SampleLibrary` feature a `priority` parameter. By default, every sample has it set to zero.

When a sample is requested to be played on a certain player, if will be played if a inactive voice is found or if its priority is _greater or equal_ than that of an active voice. That way, the default makes everything work as always has.

This allows to forbid unimportant sounds to stop important ones (defining that is up to each project).

Implemented on top of #8292. Could be rebased if needed.

As well as the other PR, _master_ is not suited to porting this to it. And, again, @reduz could have a look, at least to know the sound priority thing is desirable for 3.0.

data.title: [2.1] Cherry pick GDScript enum support ( #6292 )
Make spatial AudioServers prefer inactive voices (2.1)
data.body:
...instead of unconditionally playing on the next voice slot; that will be the fallback if no inactive voice is found.

This gives further chances for inactive voices to take the work instead of force-stopping active ones.

This PR can't be ported to _master_ due to the new architecture of the `AudioServer' or perhaps due to the point its implementation is at. Anyway, if @reduz could confirm...

data.title: mouse_enter signal doesn't fire when mouse is held
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1 stable

**Issue description:**
Title

**Steps:**
Create two buttons with 2 signals
```
	var button = Button.new()
	button.set_text("Tests")
	add_child(button)
	button.connect("mouse_enter", self, "tab_over", [button])

func tab_over(button):
	print("Fire!!!")
```

Click on one button and hold down the left mouse button, then slowly go over over the adjacent button. `mouse_enter`'s signal isn't emitted.

Can't think of this being intended, but posting this because it seems to me anyway that it should still fire.
